title: The English fortune-teller Being a brief direction how to shun all strife, a brief instruction how to chuse a wife; whereby a man may lead a happy life: it shews difference in womens qualities, by colour of their hair, both face and eyes, the tune is, Ragged and torn. &c.
publisher: printed for W[illiam]. Thackeray, T[homas]. Passenger, and W[illiam]. Whitwood,
